page.title: 07 Cossall
page.content: Cossall is a hilltop village. There is a church dedicated to St.Catherine, some almshouses and a cottage that featured in{"The Rainbow" by {D.H.Lawrence. The almshouses were built by the Willoughby family who became rich by mining the local coal. They also built {Wollaton Hall.}The church has a memorial to some local men who fought at the Battle of Waterloo. The parish of Cossall spreads beyond the hilltop site and has farms and fields within it. The village has no shops or other facilities, but The Gardener's Inn, considered to be in Awsworth, is actually in Cossall.
